results.title: Five sides of a coin = 5 sides of a coin
results.creator_credit: Paul Kell, Jana Ritter, 7th Art Releasing, Anomaly Collective and Canada Council for the Arts
results.brief_description: An informative documentary on the rise of the five elements of the Hip Hop movement - Emcee’ing, DeeJay’ing, Breakin,’ Graffiti Writing and Beatboxing. An overview for the novice or an exciting compilation for the fan, this films serves to broaden the knowledge base of the viewer by providing an understanding of the complexity of the worldwide Hip Hop genre of music. Hip Hop is more than just the commercial hits on MTV: the complex rhyming of MCs, the skill of the turntable DJs, the fancy moves of the Break Dancers, the artistry of Graffiti and the wonder of the human voice in reproducing sounds through Beatboxing are all shown and discussed by those passionate about the culture. Some of the artists featured include: Common, DeLaSoul, Grandmaster Flash, DJ Jazzy Jay, Mercedies Ladies, Prince Paul and many others. Animation by Skilla, original music by Manifest, Son of Mac, Zinndeadly, Big Dro, DJ Emergency.

results.title: Five get into trouble. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: The children are on a cycling holiday when they are joined by Richard Kent, the twelve year old son of rich parents. Two villains chase and try to capture him, but he escapes. They later kidnap Dick by mistake and take him to the gloomy and ancient manor house, Owl’s Den.

results.title: Five on treasure island. Five get into trouble
results.creator_credit: Andrew Morgan, Michael Kerrigan, Tony Kysh, John Price, Frankfurter Film, HTV, Tyne Tees Television, Zenith North Portman and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Five on a treasure island sees the Famous Five discover an old shipwreck on Kirrin Island which leads the Five into trouble and the discovery of buried treasure. “Five get into trouble” sees the Five on a cycling holiday, a case of mistaken identity, and a horde of stolen diamonds lead to kidnap and an exciting adventure in an old Elizabethan manor.

results.title: Five on Finniston Farm. Five get into a fix
results.brief_description: In the first of these two adventures the Famous Five are on holiday at Finniston Farm, where they meet Harry and Harriet (who are identical twins). They join forces with the twins against some unpleasant American visitors who are interested in the dungeons of Finniston Castle. In the second adventure, the Five are on holiday at a farm in Wales, after their trip to Switzerland is cancelled. They uncover a mystery when they start to investigate a mysterious tower.

results.title: Five of a Kind
results.creator_credit: Peter Reid and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Rare insight into the prime ministership and life at the top. There are wide-ranging interviews with five successive prime ministers from Sir John Gorton, Sir William Mcmahon, Gough Whitlam, Malcolm Fraser to Bob Hawke, tracing how the prime ministership has evolved since Federation and what the role entails today, interwoven with absorbing reflections from the five men whose terms of office span one of the most eventful eras in Australian politics. The wives of the prime ministers are also interviewed. They discuss adjusting to domestic and official life at The Lodge; the effect of stress and the prime ministerial workload on their husbands; and of the support and advice they gave their spouses.

results.title: Five billion years
results.creator_credit: Joyce Borenstein, David Verrall, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This superbly animated science film traces the evolution of North America from the Earth’s geophysical beginnings, through the genesis of the first living organisms, right up to the arrival of humans. Radiant colors and smooth-flowing animation evoke sizzling lava rivers, oceans bursting with life, and freezing ice ages. The film provides an excellent view of the time frame within which these remarkable events took place and highlights the fact that, relatively speaking, we are newcomers to Planet Earth. (Awards: Houston)

results.title: Fishermen of Pubnico
results.creator_credit: Leonard Forest, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film story about the people who live in the nine fishing villages of Pubnico on the southwest tip of the Nova Scotian peninsula. Like that of their Acadian ancestors, their livelihood is inextricably bound to the sea. Characteristic of their faith in its bounty is the quest of the captain of a fishing schooner who, after a fruitless three-week search for swordfish, borrows money and sets out again. Eight more days of scanning the waves are rewarded by a full catch and money in the pocket for the captain and his crew.

results.title: Reckless Kelly (Director's cut)
results.creator_credit: Yahoo Serious, Warwick Ross and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Reckless Kelly is a biker, a republican, a video rental addict, a man of the 90’s and the last of the great bank-robbing gang left to right the wrongs of the world. And he’s doing it his way; holding up autoteller machines and re-depositing the money into the bank accounts of the poor. Good overcomes evil and justice conquers corruption, when our legendary armour-clad hero ventures from the outback of Australia and heads off to the wild world of Hollywood and Las Vegas. Backed by a hit soundtrack featuring INXS, Divinyls, Yothu Yindi and Mental as Anything. Cast includes Yahoo Serious, Melora Hardin, Alexei Sayle, Hugo Weaving, Kathleen Freeman, John Pinette, Bob Maza.
